title: If you were immortal and you had the chance to give one other person immortality, who would it be? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let's just say I am immortal, that means I can live without getting aged (lets fix aging limit to 30 years, means  when you attain 30 years ,you will look same even after 100 years.). Here is an interesting fact ,when you stay in a single place(in a fixed job) for 10 years, people around you are getting aged ,but you are not. So what do you think will happen now. People starts noticing you are not getting aged. They starts asking questions ,they call media and within month with in a month you will become famous around the world..Now big medical institutions( reasearch) will start collecting your blood samples to check examine your DNA. So finally what will happen , major big shots in this world wants to become like you- immortal( remember those blood samples you have given generously). Intially conversion process to immortality will cost in billons,but in course of time it will become available to everyone. Imagine entire human race becoming immortal.Your boon will become your curse. So coming to your question no I won't make another person immortal. Because he or she might face the situation as explained above and they will trace you ultimately. (Please do have patience with my grammatical mistakes)

In a situation like this, I'd hope to have a really potent and powerful enemy. You know, one of those enemies that you are so compelled to hate and battle so constantly, that you understand them and love them in some way. Preferably, they would be someone that you are evenly matched with so that you could continue to battle each other without there ever being a clear winner. It would be so incredible to have an eternal mortal enemy to battle it out with for centuries, and in some sense know that there is a certain form of camaraderie in it. It wouldn't be a nightmare, or an exhausting ordeal, but a beautiful and epic rivalry that could go on for ever.
